intro: Tysonia glochidiata, commonly known as the Mexican burro bush, is a shrub native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its dense, spiny foliage and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant has a deep root system that allows it to survive in dry, rocky soils. Its leaves are typically small and covered in fine, hair-like structures that help reduce water loss. Tysonia glochidiata is well adapted to harsh desert conditions and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
